Synopsis:
The terrifying beauty of a continent extraordinary, Antarctica, serves as backdrop for a scientific mission. One finding that opens up possibilities unimaginable becomes a struggle for survival when a group of international researchers discovered an alien. The creature has the ability to change shape at will and become the perfect copy of any human being.

The paleontologist Kate Lloyd (Mary Elizabeth Winstead) has traveled to the stricken region to realize his dream. He joins a Norwegian team that accidentally found an alien spacecraft buried in the ice, and discovers an organism that seems to have died in the collision for thousands of years. But it is to wake ...

A simple experiment frees the alien of his icy prison. Kate and Carter (Joel Edgerton), the pilot of the expedition, will join forces to prevent the creature kills the team members one by one. In the white immensity, a parasite able to perfectly imitate any living thing it touches, get to flourish distrust and terror while trying to survive and flourish.

Production notes:
- Prequel of the popular 1982 film John Carpenter's 'The Thing'
